text:
hi all - a quick update:
• an article posted in the <#CJE3XC0H3|general> channel today was flagged as inappropriate and was removed.
• please don’t use the <#CJE3XC0H3|general> channel to promote your own content. if people want a channel to promote things, we can definitely create one (but i’m curious to hear if anyone really wants that)
• this makes me realize that we should put together some community guidelines. if anyone has thoughts on what should be in there, please let me know! i think guidelines will be most effective if they are sourced from the group.
thank you all for being part of this community!

this makes me realize that we should put together some community guidelines. if anyone has thoughts on what should be in there, please let me know! i think guidelines will be most effective if they are sourced from the group.
thank you all for being part of this community!

text: I recently joined another similar community and its community guidelines are a separate Slack channel, which helps keep them visible to new members. Just passing along in case it’s worth stealing.

text: I'm on the mod team of a large digital marketing slack and they explicitly have a #shameless_promotion channel just as a place to let people post things. Also they have a Friday accomplishments in the main channel which is both self-promo and a nice way to end the week.

text: Hmm. Well, didn't expect that kind of response. It certainly wasn't intended to be sexist – more a light-heated critique of politics and organizations using appealing smokescreens to mask their internal machinations. Not convinced this is the community for me. I'll respectfully depart.

Not convinced this is the community for me. I'll respectfully depart.
